@for_loopy What is written there does not mean to me what it means to you. Key word is “directly” - this is a good standard and no where is there anything in that sentence that implies a political valence.

Trying to reflect if this is me. But I guess I never assumed they weren’t “shadow banning” & always figured they were “content moderating”. I also assumed tweets that approached disinfo or hate were the ones beings by moderated so yes, maybe it affects conservatives more. https://t.co/Fuk9Tsi3kw

This is not conspiracy. It’s content moderation!! This is the problem of our time and will go one for some time until we figure out how to balance speech and harm in the era of algorithmicly amplified content.

I) every media outlet gets some gov. pressure 2) some media outlets work w/a political party and are full on partisan. 3) Twitter employees must wrestle with the consequences of their product 4) Elon proposed shadow banning himself when he proposed “freedom of speech not reach”.

Is it me, or do the correspondences within the “Twitter Files” merely reveal  the discourse of intelligent people analyzing the difficult circumstances their product presents.
@JulianMWalker Link to the comments por favor?

I would add Singal, Herzog, Rosenfield, Mounk, Weiss, Haider, Daum, French all who are alt media.

@su3su2u1 @ErikN_NJEdition @C_Kavanagh @MikeCastroFilms @StrangelEdweird @_Apost8 @JohnRWoodJr @lexfridman @GurusPod But some less than others. Nothing bothers me more than when I tell someone to listen or read this or that and they respond “oh but that person is terrible”. Some people have a practice of first judging the source and second the info, rather than vice versa.
@bbellinger @mattyglesias Key words “in the same way”.
@terrycherry428 @Anthony @MuellerSheWrote Someone who loves William F Buckley.

@C_Kavanagh @StrangelEdweird @Cole_August @JohnRWoodJr @lexfridman @GurusPod Sam Harris’s latest housekeeping on why he left Twitter is instructive here. It seems to me this thread has been woefully insufficient on how the medium intersects with all this.
@mattyglesias Can we distinguish positions like Yellen and Garland which are not political in the same way that those who have to run public races are?
@MazMHussain @SinaYanka Copts aren't around? We are almost 10% of Egypt.
Does anyone have a coherent narrative for @mtaibbi's journalistic trajectory?

@su3su2u1 @ErikN_NJEdition @C_Kavanagh @MikeCastroFilms @StrangelEdweird @_Apost8 @JohnRWoodJr @lexfridman @GurusPod I think that most of what you get in mainstream media in 2022 is partisan. I work in media, people are dug in, not open to data that discredits their priors, spend endless time in whaaboutism journalism etc. Maybe it’s not as binary as heterodox or MSM but the jist is there.
@ThinkerAspiring They should work on a uniform that makes bystanders confident that they are the safe people. Right now it lacks the signal.

@ErikN_NJEdition @su3su2u1 @C_Kavanagh @MikeCastroFilms @StrangelEdweird @_Apost8 @JohnRWoodJr @lexfridman @GurusPod There are many heterodox people who have not gone off the rails: Haidt, lukianoff, Harris, Loury, McWhorter, Hughes, Foster, Pinker, etc. Maybe some fall off through the exercise of being open to ideas, but I’ll take the losses if the alternative is partisan thoughtlessness.

@StrangelEdweird @CarlosCMTF @JohnRWoodJr @lexfridman @GurusPod And I think that’s what people are reacting to who like Lex. My brother and some friends listen for years and really like his disposition/openness and get what he’s doing. They can tolerate his mistakes. They see mistakes but tolerate them. Like I do with Sam.

@CarlosCMTF @StrangelEdweird @JohnRWoodJr @lexfridman @GurusPod Thanks, but I guarantee you there is no version of putting this film out that doesn’t come with the same criticism lodged at people in this space. But the disposition were talking about is what makes me want to do it anyway.
Did anyone see what happened to @NaomiAKlein to make her lock her account?

@CarlosCMTF @StrangelEdweird @JohnRWoodJr @lexfridman @GurusPod I’m trying something right now with a film - it’s out there for this polarized time. I’m scared I’ll do a bad job, I’m scared it won’t be worth it, im scared I’ll enable bad forces, but what we’re doing isn’t working and we have to try something else. Should I not try?

@CarlosCMTF @StrangelEdweird @JohnRWoodJr @lexfridman @GurusPod I think reactions to such posts (as illustrated by the Angel-Chris convo) reveal a natural disposition of people. What I know is that most people who try things in public fall flat on their face and that’s hard. Cynics do not appreciate it.
@CarlosCMTF @StrangelEdweird @JohnRWoodJr @lexfridman @GurusPod What solves problems in your eyes?

@CarlosCMTF @StrangelEdweird @JohnRWoodJr @lexfridman @GurusPod If you erased the Putin part it isn’t cringe to me. I guess I’m a documentary filmmaker, So I have the urge to go take my camera and talk to people in situations such as this. That’s last parts more mushy than my personality but doesn’t bother me.

@ErikN_NJEdition @C_Kavanagh @StrangelEdweird @_Apost8 @JohnRWoodJr @lexfridman @GurusPod What Chris and many others seem to miss is that a major part of what drives people off the deep end isn’t their initial inclination to engage in unorthodox topics and open communication, it’s this app, soloing, audience capture and the divisive nature of the feedback people get.

@ErikN_NJEdition @C_Kavanagh @StrangelEdweird @_Apost8 @JohnRWoodJr @lexfridman @GurusPod It’s an easy test though. If Brett says the “sun rises in the east”, you wouldn’t discount it based on the speaker right? I get the addition of the speaker to the equation but the weight one gives to knowing the speaker should be less than the weight to the statement itself.
@CarlosCMTF @StrangelEdweird @JohnRWoodJr @lexfridman @GurusPod This is good right?

@C_Kavanagh @StrangelEdweird @JohnRWoodJr @lexfridman @GurusPod I don’t follow Lex closely but I can admire his earnestness and unless one thinks that’s merely a performance I can think of worse qualities on in a public interlocutor. I do think Chris that your tolerance for those “just having conversations” is low.

@C_Kavanagh @StrangelEdweird @JohnRWoodJr @lexfridman @GurusPod I actually think he was just comparing two different approaches naive optimism and cynical realism, not saying those who criticize Alex are the cynics. He is right however you are very cynical. But I assume you stand by that?

@C_Kavanagh @kevbernt @AB33333333 You may be correct and as I haven’t followed  Rogan I don’t have enough info to say what he thinks about Jones, but in this clip that you posted he is imitating people with that statement and not speaking from his own point of view.
@CarlosCMTF @StrangelEdweird @Cole_August @JohnRWoodJr @lexfridman @GurusPod Lol. I started blocking people who seem horrible. But sure it’s a slippery slope.
@kevbernt @AB33333333 @C_Kavanagh He was imitating his fans who have taken his interview with Jones the wrong way. Reflecting on how it’s more problematic than not. I think you guys misinterpreted.
@GlennGoodrich Glenn I tried! I made it through a season but it’s too soap opera for me. If they spent one season developing plot and building up a murder or dastardly scheme I could enjoy it more.
@MazMHussain I used to do the stair master because I could read on it. But now they only have those weird stair machines which are actual stairs and it’s no longer possible. So I listen to podcasts.
I am out of wine. This is what I call a disaster. I seem to have plenty of whiskey at least.
@CentristLean @jennelizabethj @mtaibbi @Twitter @elonmusk He said he would reveal it. But i am not a supporter of his, do not subscribe to him or follow him closely.
RT @Meighon: BIG ANNOUNCEMENT! Thanks to your support we booked screenings in:  NYC-Dec 6,LA-Dec 10,Santa Monica Dec9-15,& Malibu Dec 13-Pl…
@StrangelEdweird @JohnRWoodJr @lexfridman Yet @GurusPod relentlessly attack him for naïveté and self aggrandizement.
@MazMHussain Careful - relationships with Gods and people get taken away from you on a dime as well. You should root identity in your values and how you want to show up and experience the world.
@njhochman @JulianMWalker
@VaclavHavel9 It’s hard to have less humility than adam McKay.

@ThinkerAspiring @Johnnybeesknees @and_furiouser I think all we have to protect our freedom is policy. Whether it’s fair taxes or environmental boundaries or speech, if we don’t have food policy we will foresake our freedom eventually out of discontentedness.

@ThinkerAspiring @Johnnybeesknees @and_furiouser And while I’m not ready to mass censor and worry about who’s job it is to write the censorship rules, I am worried our freedom of speech values will make it very hard to find pragmatic solutions that maximize freedom but prevent tipping into oblivion.

@ThinkerAspiring @Johnnybeesknees @and_furiouser One think I believe is that we are woefully naive about the power the social media tools have given our worst actors in society to persuade people of bad ideas. We’ve seen radicalization of young Muslim boys and we see radicalization if incel’s but we still don’t fully absorb it.

@ThinkerAspiring @and_furiouser @Johnnybeesknees This is what I liked about Harris’s brutally honest take on the Hunter Biden laptop. If you could know with certainty that exposing the laptop would lead to Trumps re-election which would lead to the last vote we ever had and our fall into authoritarianism…would you suppress it?
@JulianMWalker @micahsb Targeting a certain group wasn’t a defining feature. Labeling them the source of the problem wasnt a Pat of his fascism.

@JulianMWalker @micahsb For Putins current fascism outgroup hate isn’t a defining feature but conquest certainly is. Snyder defined it by saying “strength” defines it instead of truth or fact. And to prove strength you always have to be looking for someone to conquer. Etc.

@JulianMWalker @micahsb Yes war is a defining factor in fascism. That’s different than harping on ethnic purity. no doubt Hitlers fascism was obsessed with that, but it was not a defining feature of Mussolinis.
@Mostlyfine_99 @JulianMWalker Somewhat - he refers to it as strength and not authoritarianism. I was absolutely confused when I first heard it. It also didn’t have any economic portion.
@mattyglesias Just a smidge.

@micahsb @JulianMWalker I’ve wondered whether the outgroup part is necessary for fascism. Mussolinis fascism didn’t require it - though later he seemed to shift for expediency (but not ideologically).
@jennelizabethj @mtaibbi @Twitter @elonmusk I assume the conditions was he had to report it on Twitter and not behind his paid substack.
@ThinkerAspiring @and_furiouser @Johnnybeesknees I think it is naive. By the time we got to Jan 6 we could see maybe the realities underneath  every hard decision.
@micahsb @JulianMWalker You are probably right. They’re not exactly “working together” in the way that fascists usually do.

@JulianMWalker Yeah I read that. I’ve had a lot of discussions about fascism. It’s quite hard to define. I recently heard an interesting definition by Timothy Snyder that used none of these ideas. It’s at minute :39 on his recent Sam Harris podcast If you want to take a listen.
Good. Fairly short legal analysis. https://t.co/MMnhZLMWSo

@VaclavHavel9 Are people saying that the laptop only contained dick pics or that what the Biden campaign team asked to be removed were just Dick picks. I understood most people are talking about the latter the last two days.

@Right2BeReal @KonstantinKisin I think if there was evidence of US Government suppression then Taibbi would directly say that. Greenwalds interpretation requires assuming that Taibbi is being cryptic when from the layout of the thread it seems like he’s pretty mediated and clear.

@ElsiesWoke @wil_da_beast630 Actually on Joe Rogan it was clear Zuck said they were warned generally about Russian disinformation but not specifically about the laptop or anything else. People distorted it.

@wil_da_beast630 OMG you just now realized this?! That is the only “administration” which Taibbi said censored, the other was a campaign. I believe that it likely is both govs but according to the text it was one admin and one campaign team. And no gov interference on the laptop story.

tweets.text: The critical minerals required for batteries & solar panels largely come from China because we’re not mining enough here at home. We cannot afford for the CCP to be the global leader in energy production—we need a strategy for how we will lead the world in the new energy economy. https://t.co/bqkVFnLuL3
@Egypxican That’s why I follow you.  I would be considered “right” on most people’s political spectrum but the spectrum is false and it appears you recognize that.

@Egypxican I don’t think this was you.  I doubt you spoke on the subject.  You seem to be pretty propaganda immune and I think those on the left could see that it was happening.  But there was propaganda saying this wasn’t happening.

@thomaschattwill I think they purged some of your followers too. One time someone else I follow retweeted you, thought ‘huh, haven’t seen much from him lately.’ Click your profile and somehow I wasn’t following you anymore-no fault if my own.

@thomaschattwill Can you explain why Musk would hand pick a couple of folks who were likely to see what he sees and have them put it out this way instead of comprehensive reports? Context and framing matter.
I mean, will anyone on the left at least say, "Secretly limiting the reach of conservatives with no way to know it's happened and no way to appeal it is bad."?
@Egypxican What triggers deboosting and how it applies to the person being deboosted also matters.

25. Roth wrote: “The hypothesis underlying much of what we’ve implemented is that if exposure to, e.g., misinformation directly causes harm, we should use remediations that reduce exposure, and limiting the spread/virality of content is a good way to do that.”

@Egypxican Also perhaps I am being ungenerous but what we’ve seen from Roth elsewhere (his assertion that content moderators have lasting “trauma” from Jan 6) imputes political valence to any judgment he might make about what is harmful

Well, we’re not talking about relativism.

In the context of our work, it’s more that you can’t communicate and connect with someone unless you understand how they interpret the world. 

The facts of the world alone are not enough. Yet mere *facts* is where so many want to focus. https://t.co/5l0Risx3j4
@Egypxican How they defined these terms and how they applied those rules are really important to this conversation.
@RockyRhodes18 @Egypxican They would argue that it was not defined that way, but conservatives just happened to be bad people.

urls.title: Unredacted - Laemmle.com
urls.description: It’s hard to overstate the power of Smaker’s debut documentary. Spread the word about this film! COMING SOON OPENS tomorrow! Friday Dec. 9 A group of men trained by al-Qaeda are transferred from Guantanamo and sent to the world’s first rehabilitation center for “terrorists,” located in Saudi Arabia. Documentary, Politics & World Affairs, Justice Nominee, Grand Jury Prize ~ Documentary, Sundance Film Festival Empathy can an inherent part of the documentary form, but it seems to have been a speciality

Instagram is shadow banning my still photographs because they aren’t reels. This is the real scandal

I agree with some people poo-pooing the #Twitterfiles to this extent: This is mainly an argument over whether Twitter used good judgement in limiting the reach of bad people or bad judgement in limiting the reach of good people. What they were doing was not a secret.

The problem with the Twitter files  is that the Left has no fucking shame. The entire establishment is apart of this. It’s not like Twitter was an outlier. The Left have had the smoking gun in their hand the whole time.

The issue has always been building or retaking influence.
Why do you think #JenniferLawrence mis-spoke on her being the breakthrough pioneer female lead in an action film?
Someone with 2 followers made an insanely stupid comment today. I took the layup. I’m not proud of myself.

@StrangelEdweird @Cole_August @Egypxican @JohnRWoodJr @lexfridman @GurusPod Oh it certainly has an impact and people respond differently. @su3su2u1 @C_Kavanagh @MikeCastroFilms @StrangelEdweird @Egypxican @_Apost8 @JohnRWoodJr @lexfridman @GurusPod I agree with you (and have all along, btw) that evaluating every question fully on the merits as an individual is a fantasy.  Can you agree with me that removing individual judgement from the process is a fantasy?

@CarlosCMTF @Egypxican @JohnRWoodJr @lexfridman @GurusPod I’d prefer someone sincerely orient their behavior towards doing good in the world and be called naive or self-important for it (however true that may be about them), than not. Of course I don’t think Lex will stop the war; all I’ve been saying is I appreciate where his heart is.

@CarlosCMTF @StrangelEdweird @JohnRWoodJr @lexfridman @GurusPod I think reactions to such posts (as illustrated by the Angel-Chris convo) reveal a natural disposition of people. What I know is that most people who try things in public fall flat on their face and that’s hard. Cynics do not appreciate it.
@Egypxican @StrangelEdweird @JohnRWoodJr @lexfridman @GurusPod I guess it's all about how he phrased it.

@Egypxican @StrangelEdweird @JohnRWoodJr @lexfridman @GurusPod Even is this situation could be magically defused by having a conversation it's certainly not Lex Fridman they would pick to have it.

This is a common problem of podcasters in general - the pretentiousness of assuming that debates can solve any problems and uncover any truths.

@Egypxican @StrangelEdweird @JohnRWoodJr @lexfridman @GurusPod It's cringe at best.
Narcissist and megalomaniac at worst
But it's unbelievably naive. Almost what a child would say. 
I know it's supposed a perfectly innocent tweet though

@ErikN_NJEdition @C_Kavanagh @StrangelEdweird @_Apost8 @JohnRWoodJr @lexfridman @GurusPod It’s an easy test though. If Brett says the “sun rises in the east”, you wouldn’t discount it based on the speaker right? I get the addition of the speaker to the equation but the weight one gives to knowing the speaker should be less than the weight to the statement itself.
@C_Kavanagh @StrangelEdweird @_Apost8 @Egypxican @JohnRWoodJr @lexfridman @GurusPod And further that would be a personal difference, not anything inherent to the distinction you two are arguing.
@Egypxican @StrangelEdweird @JohnRWoodJr @lexfridman @GurusPod I think this tweet effectively shows his fundamental demeanor https://t.co/eSLhmIjTyF

@C_Kavanagh @StrangelEdweird @JohnRWoodJr @lexfridman @GurusPod I actually think he was just comparing two different approaches naive optimism and cynical realism, not saying those who criticize Alex are the cynics. He is right however you are very cynical. But I assume you stand by that?

@StrangelEdweird @JohnRWoodJr @Egypxican @lexfridman @GurusPod That’s a single example. There are many, many more. How many would it take for you to regard as accurate rather than too cynical to suggest Lex might be naive?
@Egypxican @kevbernt @AB33333333 You are wrong. Joe has reiterated this point on multiple occasions. He thinks Alex gets most things right but makes some silly mistakes.

@StrangelEdweird @Cole_August @Egypxican @JohnRWoodJr @lexfridman @GurusPod I agree
https://t.co/CIBHaIVl5F
@AB33333333 @C_Kavanagh Yes, that little detail may be the most disturbing part of a mildly disturbing clip.  But both of them are right wing podcasters.
@Egypxican Time to start watching Yellowstone.

After years of assuming it was logically impossible I saw a guy at the gym running on the treadmill while reading a book. Rather than a one-time failed experiment I even saw him today running and reading again. This guy is living my wildest fantasy.

urls.title: The UnRedacted (Jihad Rehab), organized by Meg Smaker
urls.description: Hi, my name is Meg Smaker and I am the director of the documentary The UnRedacted (Jihad Reha… Meg Smaker needs your support for The UnRedacted (Jihad Rehab)

tweets.text: BIG ANNOUNCEMENT! Thanks to your support we booked screenings in:  NYC-Dec 6,LA-Dec 10,Santa Monica Dec9-15,& Malibu Dec 13-Please visit the GoFundMe page for event details. Looking forward to seeing you in Dec! We hope to announce MORE locations soon! https://t.co/N8vSQHSw8w
@JohnRWoodJr @lexfridman He’s certainly trying his damnedest.

I would suggest that whatever you do you put full pride into it but also that your sense of identity derives from things that can never be replaced by technology. This could mean your relationships with other people or spirituality and connection to God if so inclined.

Are there any good essays/etc from smart left-wing thinkers about what distinguishes fascism from “normal” right-wing politics? The academic literature on fascism often describes it in abstract terms that could feasibly be applied to a large swathe of mainstream conservatism

Seeing Jordan Peele make the same career turn as Adam McKay with the same basic capacity to operate at a higher level but far less humility. The way Peele acts in public now is probably more revelation than evolution but god. To be that funny and choose pretension
@Egypxican @Johnnybeesknees @and_furiouser Probably. Freedom only lasts as long as we want it to. I'm just not convinced there's any hack or policy to stop that.

@ThinkerAspiring @Johnnybeesknees @and_furiouser One think I believe is that we are woefully naive about the power the social media tools have given our worst actors in society to persuade people of bad ideas. We’ve seen radicalization of young Muslim boys and we see radicalization if incel’s but we still don’t fully absorb it.

@Johnnybeesknees @Egypxican @and_furiouser Abortion restrictions are a good example of something that some people view as a restriction of rights and other people view as a necessary part of protecting rights.
@Egypxican @and_furiouser @Johnnybeesknees I believe a lot of naive things. One more won't hurt.

@micahsb @Egypxican .. The Italian border should run across the Brenner Pass, Monte Nevoso and the Dinaric Alps ... I would say we can easily sacrifice 500,000 barbaric Slavs for 50,000 Italians.”
— Benito Mussolini, speech held in Pola, 20 September 1920

@JulianMWalker @micahsb Yes war is a defining factor in fascism. That’s different than harping on ethnic purity. no doubt Hitlers fascism was obsessed with that, but it was not a defining feature of Mussolinis.
@micahsb @Egypxican “Campaign of invasions.” *

If Elon Musk wants to give me exclusive access to internal twitter documents, I’d be happy to do some PR for the world’s richest man — and if he really has the goods on the libs, probably a little more credible coming from me than Taibbi.

@Egypxican @JulianMWalker The way fascists usually work together is authoritarian govt police state + capitalist support + moral panic about an outgroup that is corrupting the purity of the dominant ethnic group.

@mtaibbi @Twitter @elonmusk Thank you for answering. That does matter. I look forward to hearing what conditions you did agree to. I do have faith. But certainly not in Elon. Or his proported purpose in this. But none of that matters if everything is transparent and power is held to account.
@and_furiouser @Johnnybeesknees Maybe it is naive, but I prefer it to the cynicism of squashing stories because it might hurt our preferred political cause.
@Egypxican @JulianMWalker The info shared by Matt doesn't really in any way suggest that to be true.
@Egypxican https://t.co/4frVT8du6v

urls.title: Elon Musk and Tucker Carlson Don’t Understand the First Amendment
urls.description: Twitter is a private company, not the federal government—something Elon Musk and Tucker Carlson fail to understand, @DavidAFrench writes:

tweets.text: Deleting pornographic pictures of Hunter Biden was appropriate. Twitter's suppression of the New York Post story about Hunter’s laptop was far less defensible. But no amount of misguided rhetoric can transform a Twitter story into a government scandal. https://t.co/srFyYcFyDX

Yeah honestly maybe there are a few lib-centrist commentators who wouldn’t care if Don Jr did what Hunter did but I really fucking doubt it and it would be used by the entire media as proof of Trumps corruption. We can’t help but live in reaction to how they behave about shit https://t.co/5hnHROEmO0

@Egypxican @KonstantinKisin Do they say that though? Greenwald seems to think otherwise, and I think I agree with him there.
https://t.co/bhXtLJaatM

@Egypxican @wil_da_beast630 Didn’t Mark Zuckerberg state that the FBI approached Facebook and took the position that the laptop story was Russian disinformation?  

Isn’t it likely they did the same at Twitter?  If so, do you suppose that Biden people asked them?

Gotta say: something that's being ignored as re all this twitter scandal stuff is that the platform also took down tweets and suspended people at the request of the Trump administration - i.e. the actual government.

Who were they? #rip_Chapo?
